intro: Erigeron pycnotrichus, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant features a basal rosette of gray-green, woolly leaves that help it retain moisture. Its flowering stems bear small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, typically blooming in late summer. Erigeron pycnotrichus is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes.
